variable.name: NEE_C
extended.description: Annual net exchange of CO2 between the ecosystem and atmosphere, commonly measured using eddy-covariance. Sign convention: negative indicates C uptake.
IPCC.notes: Equation 2.3 (although include some heterotrofic)
review.notes: Consistency checks--mostly. Most of the time, ecologists assume -NEE (net CO2 exchange between ecosystem and atmosphere) =NEP (GPP-Reco)= _C (change in total carbon stock. In reality, there are some ways  in which these can differ. For example, fire and ultraviolet oxidation of organic matter release CO2 without any biological role (NEP not equal), carbon can leave the site as dissolved inorganic carbon (NEE not equal). Harvest would not technically be included in either definition (but generally wouldn't occur concurrently with the measurements recorded in ForC. I think it's reasonable to treat bouth NEE and GPP as equivalent to ÆC in most cases that will be encountered in ForC.

variable.name: NEE_cum_C
extended.description: NA

variable.name: NEP_C
extended.description: Annual net ecosystem production estimated biometrically / from ground-based measurements. Sign convention: positive indicates C uptake.
review.notes: Consistency checks--mostly. Most of the time, ecologists assume -NEE (net CO2 exchange between ecosystem and atmosphere) =NEP (GPP-Reco)= _C (change in total carbon stock. In reality, there are some ways  in which these can differ. For example, fire and ultraviolet oxidation of organic matter release CO2 without any biological role (NEP not equal), carbon can leave the site as dissolved inorganic carbon (NEE not equal). Harvest would not technically be included in either definition (but generally wouldn't occur concurrently with the measurements recorded in ForC. I think it's reasonable to treat bouth NEE and GPP as equivalent to ÆC in most cases that will be encountered in ForC.

variable.name: GPP_C
extended.description: Annual Gross Primary Production (GPP), commonly estimated through flux partitioning of eddy covariance. Also known as "Gross Ecosystem Production".
equations: (1)* GPP_C = R_eco_C - NEE_C; (2)** GPP_C = NPP_5_C + R_auto_C
IPCC.notes: alone it doesn't suffice for inventories and may be wrongly used

variable.name: GPP_cum_C
extended.description: NA

variable.name: TBCF_C
extended.description: Annual Total belowground C flux (through roots), including carbon that will go to root production and root-associated respiration.
IPCC.notes: *Equation 2.8
review.notes: I'm confused as to (1) how this applies to equation 2.8, and (2) If this is really useful. It gives total C allocation belowground through the roots, but does not distinguish what goes into root productivity vs C that is quickly respired ( root respiration or exudates). This could be used, together with other terms, to get a belowground C balance, but you'd also need other variables (including soil respiratin variables) to partition into what goes into ÆC_root vs ÆSOC vs root turnover/ respiration. The majority of this will be rapidly cycling carbon that I don't think is relevant.

variable.name: NPP_1_OM
extended.description: Annual Net Primary Production (NPP), including foliage, branch, stem, coarse root, and fine root.
equations: NPP_1_OM = ANPP_foliage_OM + (ANPP_woody_stem_OM + ANPP_woody_branch_OM) + BNPP_coarse root_OM + BNPP_fine root_OM

variable.name: NPP_1_C
extended.description: Annual Net Primary Production (NPP), including foliage, branch, stem, coarse root, and fine root.
equations: NPP_1_C = ANPP_foliage_C + (ANPP_woody_stem_C + ANPP_woody_branch_C) + BNPP_coarse root_C + BNPP_fine root_C

variable.name: NPP_2_OM
extended.description: Annual Net Primary Production (NPP), including foliage, branch, stem, coarse root, fine root, and understory.

variable.name: NPP_2_C
extended.description: Annual Net Primary Production (NPP), including foliage, branch, stem, coarse root, fine root, and understory.

variable.name: NPP_3_OM
extended.description: Annual Net Primary Production (NPP), including foliage, branch, stem, coarse root, fine root, understory and reproductive NPP.

variable.name: NPP_3_C
extended.description: Annual Net Primary Production (NPP), including foliage, branch, stem, coarse root, fine root, understory and reproductive NPP.

variable.name: NPP_4_OM
extended.description: Annual Net Primary Production (NPP), including foliage, branch, stem, coarse root, fine root, understory, reproductive and herbivory.

variable.name: NPP_4_C
extended.description: Annual Net Primary Production (NPP), including foliage, branch, stem, coarse root, fine root, understory, reproductive and herbivory.

variable.name: NPP_5_OM
extended.description: Annual Total Net Primary Production (NPP), including foliage, branch, stem, coarse root, fine root, understory, reproductive, herbivory, VOC and exudation.

variable.name: NPP_5_C
extended.description: Annual Total Net Primary Production (NPP), including foliage, branch, stem, coarse root, fine root, understory, reproductive, herbivory, VOC and exudation.

variable.name: NPP_0_OM
extended.description: Annual Net Primary Production (NPP), where components included are unknown/do not fit the definition of other NPP variables.

variable.name: NPP_0_C
extended.description: Annual Net Primary Production (NPP), where components included are unknown/do not fit the definition of other NPP variables.

variable.name: NPP_woody_OM
extended.description: Annual woody Net Primary Production : annual production of woody biomass (branch, stem, coarse root) estimated using allometric equations.
review.notes: Important to note that this is NOT the same as live biomass increment (ÆC, or GTOTAL in equation 2.9, or delta.agb for aboveground biomass in ForC) because it does not account for woody mortality. Rather, ÆC=NPP_woody-woody mortality (needing to account for aboveground and roots, which is not a variable in ForC). Also note that NPP includes both aboveground and belowground components. ANPP and BNPP variables separate these. I don't think this works with equation 2.10, but could be useful in the gain-loss method.

variable.name: NPP_woody_C
extended.description: Annual woody Net Primary Production : annual production of woody biomass C (branch, stem, coarse root) estimated using allometric equations.
review.notes: Important to note that this is NOT the same as live biomass increment (ÆC, or GTOTAL in equation 2.9, or delta.agb for aboveground biomass in ForC) because it does not account for woody mortality. Rather, ÆC=NPP_woody-woody mortality (needing to account for aboveground and roots, which is not a variable in ForC). Also note that NPP includes both aboveground and belowground components. ANPP and BNPP variables separate these. I don't think this works with equation 2.10, but could be useful in the gain-loss method.

variable.name: NPP_understory_OM
extended.description: Annual understory Net Primary Production (NPP). Components included may vary.
IPCC.notes: For annual biomass this parameter is not needed for NGHGI

variable.name: NPP_understory_C
extended.description: Annual understory Net Primary Production (NPP). Components included may vary.
IPCC.notes: For annual biomass this parameter is not needed for NGHGI

variable.name: NPP_litter_OM
description: Net Primary Production: fine detrital component (NPP_litter)
extended.description: Annual fine detrital production: litterfall + rine root turnover
review.notes: I sent an email 3/30 saying that I'd deleted this variable but then reinstated because I hadn't realized that there are some records for it in ForC. However, it's still a strange variable, and I'm not sure how useful. It includes (without separation) inputs to both the litter layer (litterfall) and soil layer (death of fine roots). Most of this carbon will turn over rapidly. The carbon increment of litter and soil combined would be equal to this minus respiration of R_het_soil-R_het_litter.

variable.name: NPP_litter_C
description: Net Primary Production: fine detrital component (NPP_litter)
extended.description: Annual fine detrital production: litterfall + rine root turnover
review.notes: I sent an email 3/30 saying that I'd deleted this variable but then reinstated because I hadn't realized that there are some records for it in ForC. However, it's still a strange variable, and I'm not sure how useful. It includes (without separation) inputs to both the litter layer (litterfall) and soil layer (death of fine roots). Most of this carbon will turn over rapidly. The carbon increment of litter and soil combined would be equal to this minus respiration of R_het_soil-R_het_litter.

variable.name: ANPP_1_OM
extended.description: Annual aboveground Net Primary Production (ANPP), including litterfall and stem growth.
IPCC.notes: all variables where we have the production of non-woody bioamss (leaves, grass) cannot be used since Inventories do not count for non-woody biomass gain and losses (they count in term of stock loss/gain in case of conversion)
review.notes: note, though, that aboveground biomass estimates include foliage (which is a very small component)

variable.name: ANPP_1_C
extended.description: Annual aboveground Net Primary Production (ANPP), including litterfall and stem growth.
IPCC.notes: all variables where we have the production of non-woody bioamss (leaves, grass) cannot be used since Inventories do not count for non-woody biomass gain and losses (they count in term of stock loss/gain in case of conversion)

variable.name: ANPP_2_OM
extended.description: Annual aboveground Net Primary Production (ANPP), including litterfall, stem growth, and branch turnover.
equations: (1) ANPP_2_OM = ANPP_foliage_OM + ANPP_woody_stem_OM + ANPP_woody_branch_OM; (2) ANPP_2_OM = ANPP_foliage_OM + ANPP_woody_OM
IPCC.notes: all variables where we have the production of non-woody bioamss (leaves, grass) cannot be used since Inventories do not count for non-woody biomass gain and losses (they count in term of stock loss/gain in case of conversion)

variable.name: ANPP_2_C
extended.description: Annual aboveground Net Primary Production (ANPP), including litterfall, stem growth, and branch turnover.
equations: (1) ANPP_2_C = ANPP_foliage_C + ANPP_woody_stem_C + ANPP_woody_branch_C; (2) ANPP_2_C = ANPP_foliage_C + ANPP_woody_C
IPCC.notes: all variables where we have the production of non-woody bioamss (leaves, grass) cannot be used since Inventories do not count for non-woody biomass gain and losses (they count in term of stock loss/gain in case of conversion)

variable.name: ANPP_0_OM
extended.description: Annual aboveground Net Primary Production (ANPP), where components included are unknown/do not fit the definition of ANPP_1 or ANPP_2.

variable.name: ANPP_0_C
extended.description: Annual aboveground Net Primary Production (ANPP), where components included are unknown/do not fit the definition of ANPP_1 or ANPP_2.

variable.name: ANPP_woody_OM
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: woody component (ANPP_woody)
extended.description: Annual aboveground woody production, including stem growth and branch turnover.
review.notes: Important to note that this is NOT the same as live biomass increment (ÆC, or GTOTAL in equation 2.9, or delta.agb for aboveground biomass in ForC) because it does not account for woody mortality. Rather, Æaboveground biomass=ANPP_woody-woody.mortality_ag-ANPP_woody_branch. I don't think this works with equation 2.8, but could be useful in the gain-loss method.

variable.name: ANPP_woody_C
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: woody component (ANPP_woody)
extended.description: Annual aboveground woody production, including stem growth and branch turnover.
review.notes: Important to note that this is NOT the same as live biomass increment (ÆC, or GTOTAL in equation 2.9, or delta.agb for aboveground biomass in ForC) because it does not account for woody mortality. Rather, Æaboveground biomass=ANPP_woody-woody.mortality_ag-ANPP_woody_branch.I don't think this works with equation 2.8, but could be useful in the gain-loss method.

variable.name: ANPP_woody_stem_OM
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: woody stem component (ANPP_woody_stem)
extended.description: Annual aboveground woody production accounting for stem growth but not branch fall;  i.e., wood (including branch) increment determined using allometric equations relating aboveground woody biomass increment to changes in stem diameter of all individual trees in the plot. Also known as "coarse woody productivity".
review.notes: Important to note that this is NOT the same as live biomass increment (ÆC, or GTOTAL in equation 2.9, or delta.agb for aboveground biomass in ForC) because it does not account for woody mortality. Rather, Æaboveground biomass=ANPP_woody_stem-woody.mortality_ag. I don't think this works with equation 2.8, but could be useful in the gain-loss method.

variable.name: ANPP_woody_stem_C
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: woody stem component (ANPP_woody_stem)
extended.description: Annual aboveground woody production accounting for stem growth but not branch fall;  i.e., wood (including branch) increment determined using allometric equations relating aboveground woody biomass increment to changes in stem diameter of all individual trees in the plot. Also known as "coarse woody productivity".
review.notes: Important to note that this is NOT the same as live biomass increment (ÆC, or GTOTAL in equation 2.9, or delta.agb for aboveground biomass in ForC) because it does not account for woody mortality. Rather, Æaboveground biomass=ANPP_woody_stem-woody.mortality_ag. I don't think this works with equation 2.8, but could be useful in the gain-loss method.

variable.name: ANPP_woody_branch_OM
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: woody branch component (ANPP_woody_branch)
extended.description: Annual branch turnover, typically determined by collecting branch fall throughout the year.
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (litter or dead wood, depending on size threshold. Usually litter)

variable.name: ANPP_woody_branch_C
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: woody branch component (ANPP_woody_branch)
extended.description: Annual branch turnover, typically determined by collecting branch fall throughout the year.
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (litter or dead wood, depending on size threshold. Usually litter)

variable.name: ANPP_foliage_OM
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: foliage component (ANPP_foliage)
extended.description: Annual foliage production, typically estimated by collecting leaf/needle fall throughout the year, but ideally correcting for changes in leaf biomass when measured.
equations: ANPP_foliage_OM = (total leaf production) - ANPP_folivory_OM + (change in biomass_ag_foliage_OM)

variable.name: ANPP_foliage_C
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: foliage component (ANPP_foliage)
extended.description: Annual foliage production, typically estimated by collecting leaf/needle fall throughout the year, but ideally correcting for changes in leaf biomass when measured.
equations: ANPP_foliage_C = (total leaf production) - ANPP_folivory_C + (change in biomass_ag_foliage_C)

variable.name: ANPP_litterfall_1_OM
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: litterfall component (ANPP_litterfall)
extended.description: Anuall litterfall, including leaves, twigs, and reproductive structures.
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (litter component). Not complete (excludes belowgroud, branches, small trees).

variable.name: ANPP_litterfall_1_C
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: litterfall component (ANPP_litterfall)
extended.description: Anuall litterfall, including leaves, twigs, and reproductive structures.
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (litter component). Not complete (excludes belowgroud, branches, small trees).

variable.name: ANPP_litterfall_2_OM
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: litterfall component (ANPP_litterfall)
extended.description: Annual litterfall, including leaves, twigs, reproductive structures, and small branches/ wood/ large twigs.
equations: ANPP_litterfall_2_OM = ANPP_litterfall_1_OM + ( ANPP_small branches/ large twigs_OM)
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (litter component). Not complete (excludes belowgroud, branches, small trees).

variable.name: ANPP_litterfall_2_C
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: litterfall component (ANPP_litterfall)
extended.description: Annual litterfall, including leaves, twigs, reproductive structures, and small branches/ wood/ large twigs.
equations: ANPP_litterfall_2_C = ANPP_litterfall_1_C + ( ANPP_small branches/ large twigs_C)
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (litter component). Not complete (excludes belowgroud, branches, small trees).

variable.name: ANPP_litterfall_0_OM
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: litterfall component (ANPP_litterfall)
extended.description: Annual litterfall, where components included are not specified.

variable.name: ANPP_litterfall_0_C
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: litterfall component (ANPP_litterfall)
extended.description: Annual litterfall, where components included are not specified.

variable.name: ANPP_repro_OM
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: reproduction component (ANPP_repro)
extended.description: Annual allocation of NPP to reproductive structures (fruits, flowers, seeds).

variable.name: ANPP_repro_C
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: reproduction component (ANPP_repro)
extended.description: Annual allocation of NPP to reproductive structures (fruits, flowers, seeds).

variable.name: ANPP_folivory_OM
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: folivory component (ANPP_folivory)
extended.description: Annual leaf consumption by herbivores, defined here as a direct component of ANPP (as opposed to a component of ANPP_foliage)*.
equations: ANPP_folivory_OM = (total leaf production_OM) - ANPP_foliage_OM + (change in biomass_ag_foliage_OM)

variable.name: ANPP_folivory_C
description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: folivory component (ANPP_folivory)
extended.description: Annual leaf consumption by herbivores, defined here as a direct component of ANPP (as opposed to a component of ANPP_foliage)*.
equations: ANPP_folivory_C = (total leaf production_C) - ANPP_foliage_C + (change in biomass_ag_foliage_C)

variable.name: woody.mortality_OM
extended.description: Annual woody mortality--i.e., total biomass (aboveground + root) of tree stems that die.
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (dead wood component). For a dead wood size threshold of 10cm, this would generally account for all inputs to the dead wood component, although large branch fall would not be captured.

variable.name: woody.mortality_C
extended.description: Annual woody mortality--i.e., total biomass (aboveground + root) of tree stems that die.
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (dead wood component). For a dead wood size threshold of 10cm, this would generally account for all inputs to the dead wood component, although large branch fall would not be captured.

variable.name: woody.mortality_ag_OM
extended.description: Annual aboveground woody mortality--i.e., total aboveground biomass of tree stems that die.
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (dead wood component). For a dead wood size threshold of 10cm, this would generally account for all inputs to the dead wood component, although large branch fall + roots would not be captured.

variable.name: woody.mortality_ag_C
extended.description: Annual aboveground woody mortality--i.e., total aboveground biomass of tree stems that die.
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (dead wood component). For a dead wood size threshold of 10cm, this would generally account for all inputs to the dead wood component, although large branch fall + roots would not be captured.

variable.name: woody.mortality_root_OM
extended.description: Annual belowground woody mortality--i.e., total root biomass of tree stems that die.
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (dead wood component).

variable.name: woody.mortality_root_C
extended.description: Annual belowground woody mortality--i.e., total root biomass of tree stems that die.
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_in (dead wood component).

variable.name: BNPP_root_OM
extended.description: Annual net primary production of coarse and fine roots.
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful since it may be applied with the variable on losses in a gain and loss type of IPCC equation limited to belowground biomass
review.notes: As  you note, and as with ANPP_woody, losses would need to be subtracted to get biomass/ C increment of roots. The coarse root component would be the more relevant one, and unfortunately we don't have a variable in ForC quantifying the loss of these. Decay of dead roots would be included in R_soil (in theory R_soil_het, but in practice fine root decay would often get included in R_auto_root).

variable.name: BNPP_root_C
extended.description: Annual net primary production of coarse and fine roots.
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful since it may be applied with the variable on losses in a gain and loss type of IPCC equation limited to belowground biomass
review.notes: As  you note, and as with ANPP_woody, losses would need to be subtracted to get biomass/ C increment of roots. The coarse root component would be the more relevant one, and unfortunately we don't have a variable in ForC quantifying the loss of these. Decay of dead roots would be included in R_soil (in theory R_soil_het, but in practice fine root decay would often get included in R_auto_root).

variable.name: BNPP_root_coarse_OM
description: Belowground Net Primary Production: coarse root component (BNPP_coarse)
extended.description: Annual net primary production of coarse roots, typically determined using allometric equations relating root mass to stem diameter.
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful since it may be applied with the variable on losses in a gain and loss type of IPCC equation limited to belowground biomass
review.notes: As  you note, and as with ANPP_woody, losses would need to be subtracted to get biomass/ C increment of roots. The coarse root component would be the more relevant one, and unfortunately we don't have a variable in ForC quantifying the loss of these. Decay of dead coarse roots would be included in R_soil_het.

variable.name: BNPP_root_coarse_C
description: Belowground Net Primary Production: coarse root component (BNPP_coarse)
extended.description: Annual net primary production of coarse roots, typically determined using allometric equations relating root mass to stem diameter.
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful since it may be applied with the variable on losses in a gain and loss type of IPCC equation limited to belowground biomass
review.notes: As  you note, and as with ANPP_woody, losses would need to be subtracted to get biomass/ C increment of roots. The coarse root component would be the more relevant one, and unfortunately we don't have a variable in ForC quantifying the loss of these. Decay of dead coarse roots would be included in R_soil_het.

variable.name: BNPP_root_fine_OM
description: Belowground Net Primary Production: fine root component (BNPP_fine)
extended.description: Annual net primary production of fine roots, estimated using a variety of methods including minirhizotrons, repeat coring, and ingrowth cores.
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful since it may be applied with the variable on losses in a gain and loss type of IPCC equation limited to belowground biomass
review.notes: I'm not sure you'd want this. Fine roots could be seen as the belowground parallel to leaves: relatively low biomass (rarely >5 Mg C/ha) with rapid turnover. Fine root biomass increment (production - turnover) would be very small in most forests, as fine root biomass stabilizes relatively quickly following disturbance.

variable.name: BNPP_root_fine_C
description: Belowground Net Primary Production: fine root component (BNPP_fine)
extended.description: Annual net primary production of fine roots, estimated using a variety of methods including minirhizotrons, repeat coring, and ingrowth cores.
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful since it may be applied with the variable on losses in a gain and loss type of IPCC equation limited to belowground biomass
review.notes: I'm not sure you'd want this. Fine roots could be seen as the belowground parallel to leaves: relatively low biomass (rarely >5 Mg C/ha) with rapid turnover. Fine root biomass increment (production - turnover) would be very small in most forests, as fine root biomass stabilizes relatively quickly following disturbance.

variable.name: BNPP_root.turnover_fine_OM
description: Belowground Net Primary Production: fine root turnover (BNPP_root.turnover_fine)
extended.description: Annual turnover (mortality) of fine roots.
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful since it may be applied with the variable on losses in a gain and loss type of IPCC equation limited to belowground biomass
review.notes: I'm not sure you'd want this. Fine roots could be seen as the belowground parallel to leaves: relatively low biomass (rarely >5 Mg C/ha) with rapid turnover. Fine root biomass increment (production - turnover) would be very small in most forests, as fine root biomass stabilizes relatively quickly following disturbance.

variable.name: BNPP_root.turnover_fine_C
description: Belowground Net Primary Production: fine root turnover (BNPP_root.turnover_fine)
extended.description: Annual turnover (mortality) of fine roots.
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful since it may be applied with the variable on losses in a gain and loss type of IPCC equation limited to belowground biomass
review.notes: I'm not sure you'd want this. Fine roots could be seen as the belowground parallel to leaves: relatively low biomass (rarely >5 Mg C/ha) with rapid turnover. Fine root biomass increment (production - turnover) would be very small in most forests, as fine root biomass stabilizes relatively quickly following disturbance.

variable.name: R_eco_C
extended.description: Annual ecosystem respiration, commonly estimated through flux partitioning of eddy covariance. Sign convention: positive.
equations: (1)* R_eco_C = NEE_C - GPP_C; (2) R_eco_C = R_auto_C + R_het_soil_C

variable.name: R_eco_cum_C
extended.description: Cumulative ecosystem respiration over a specified time frame (measured using eddy-covariance or gas exchange in a closed chamber). Sign convention: positive.

variable.name: R_auto_C
extended.description: Annual autotrophic respiration, including above- and belowground components.

variable.name: R_auto_ag_C
extended.description: Annual aboveground autotrophic respiration

variable.name: R_auto_wood_C
extended.description: Annual aboveground respiration of woody stems

variable.name: R_auto_foliage_C
extended.description: Annual foliar respiration

variable.name: R_auto_root_C
extended.description: Annual root respiration (all size classes).

variable.name: R_soil_C
extended.description: Annual soil respiration

variable.name: R_het_soil_C
extended.description: Annual soil heterotrophic respiration
IPCC.notes: not needed
review.notes: In theory, this can be used to help construct a belowground C balance. In practice, it's complex, and should only be done at a site level. I'd recommend avoiding this, at least for now.

variable.name: R_het_litter_C
extended.description: Annual respiration from litter decomposition
IPCC.notes: IPCC understands this is the dead organic matter decay so useful as DOM outputs
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_out (litter component).

variable.name: R_het_deadwood
extended.description: Annual respiration from deadwood decomposition
IPCC.notes: IPCC understands  this is the dead organic matter decay so useful as DOM outputs
review.notes: Consistency checks. This will be one component of DOM_out (dead wood component).

variable.name: R_het_ag_C
extended.description: Annual aboveground heterotrophic respiration

variable.name: R_het_C
extended.description: Annual heterotrophic respiration

variable.name: delta.total.ecosystem_C
description: Total Ecosystem C stock increment, soil included (delta.total.ecosystem_C)
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total ecosystem C stock, including total biomass, deadwood, organic layer, and soil organic C.  Also known as "Net Ecosystem Carbon Balance (NECB)", as defined in Chapin et al. 2006.

variable.name: delta.total.ecosystem_2_C
description: Total Ecosystem C stock increment, soil excluded (delta.total.ecosystem_2_C)
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total ecosystem carbon in organic matter, including total biomass, deadwood, and organic layer but excluding soil organic carbon.

variable.name: delta.biomass_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total live biomass (above and below-ground).

variable.name: delta.biomass_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total carbon in live biomass (above and below-ground).

variable.name: delta.agb_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in live aboveground biomass
review.notes: Consitency checks.

variable.name: delta.agb_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in carbon in live aboveground biomass
review.notes: Consitency checks.

variable.name: delta.biomass_root_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total root biomass.

variable.name: delta.biomass_root_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total carbon in root biomass

variable.name: delta.biomass_root_coarse_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total coarse root biomass. Typical size cutoff (min.diameter_root) is 1-2 mm diameter.

variable.name: delta.biomass_root_coarse_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total carbon in coarse root biomass. Typical size cutoff (min.diameter_root) is 1-2 mm diameter.

variable.name: delta.biomass_root_fine_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total fine root biomass. Typical size cutoff (max.diameter_root) is 1-2 mm diameter.

variable.name: delta.biomass_root_fine_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total carbon in fine root biomass. Typical size cutoff (max.diameter_root) is 1-2 mm diameter.

variable.name: delta.deadwood_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total mass of aboveground dead wood, including standing dead wood and woody debris.

variable.name: delta.deadwood_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total carbon in aboveground dead wood, including standing dead wood and woody debris.

variable.name: delta.deadwood_standing_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total mass of aboveground standing dead wood (snags).

variable.name: delta.deadwood_standing_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total carbon in aboveground standing dead wood (snags).

variable.name: delta.deadwood_down_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total mass of downed dead wood (coarse and sometimes fine woody debris).

variable.name: delta.deadwood_down_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in total carbon in downed dead wood (coarse and sometimes fine woody debris).

variable.name: delta.litter_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in mass of litter, or relatively undecomposed plant material (OL soil horizon).
review.notes: incomplete in that it doesn't include full O horizon, or belowground

variable.name: delta.litter_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in C in litter, or relatively undecomposed plant material (OL soil horizon).
review.notes: incomplete in that it doesn't include full O horizon, or belowground

variable.name: delta.organic.layer_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in mass of litter/ organic layer/ forest floor, where components included have not been clearly defined
review.notes: ambiguous as to whether this is just litter or entire O.horizon; therefore, not sent to IPCC

variable.name: delta.organic.layer_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in C content of litter/ organic layer/ forest floor, where components included have not been clearly defined
review.notes: ambiguous as to whether this is just litter or entire O.horizon; therefore, not sent to IPCC

variable.name: delta.O.horizon_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in mass of entire organic horizon, including litter (OL), fumic (OF), and humic (OH) layers.

variable.name: delta.O.horizon_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in C content of entire organic horizon, including litter (OL), fumic (OF), and humic (OH) layers.

variable.name: delta.soil_OM
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in soil organic matter to specified depth in mineral soil.

variable.name: delta.soil_C
extended.description: Net increment (accounting for gains + losses) in soil organic carbon to specified depth in mineral soil.

variable.name: total.ecosystem_C
description: Total Ecosystem C stock, soil included (total.ecosystem_C)
extended.description: Total ecosystem C stock, including total biomass, deadwood, organic layer, and soil organic C
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful

variable.name: total.ecosystem_2_C
description: Total Ecosystem C stock, soil excluded (total.ecosystem_2_C)
extended.description: Total ecosystem carbon in organic matter, including total biomass, deadwood, and organic layer but excluding soil organic carbon.
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful

variable.name: biomass_OM
extended.description: Total live biomass.

variable.name: biomass_C
extended.description: Total carbon in live biomass.

variable.name: biomass_ag_OM
extended.description: Total live aboveground biomass.

variable.name: biomass_ag_C
extended.description: Total carbon in live aboveground biomass.

variable.name: biomass_ag_woody_OM
extended.description: Total aboveground woody (stem + branch) biomass

variable.name: biomass_ag_woody_C
extended.description: Total carbon in aboveground woody (stem + branch) biomass

variable.name: biomass_ag_foliage_OM
extended.description: Total foliage biomass
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful

variable.name: biomass_ag_foliage_C
extended.description: Total carbon in foliage biomass
IPCC.notes: Not IPCC but could be useful

variable.name: biomass_ag_understory_OM
extended.description: Total understory biomass.

variable.name: biomass_ag_understory_C
extended.description: Total carbon in understory biomass.

variable.name: biomass_root_OM
extended.description: Total root biomass.
IPCC.notes: IPCC guidance (Table 1.1): may include or exclude fine roots (<2mm diameter)

variable.name: biomass_root_C
extended.description: Total carbon in root biomass
IPCC.notes: IPCC guidance (Table 1.1): may include or exclude fine roots (<2mm diameter)

variable.name: biomass_root_coarse_OM
extended.description: Total coarse root biomass. Typical size cutoff (min.diameter_root) is 1-2 mm diameter.
IPCC.notes: IPCC guidance (Table 1.1): may include or exclude fine roots (<2mm diameter)

variable.name: biomass_root_coarse_C
extended.description: Total carbon in coarse root biomass. Typical size cutoff (min.diameter_root) is 1-2 mm diameter.
IPCC.notes: IPCC guidance (Table 1.1): may include or exclude fine roots (<2mm diameter)

variable.name: biomass_root_fine_OM
extended.description: Total fine root biomass. Typical size cutoff (max.diameter_root) is 1-2 mm diameter.

variable.name: biomass_root_fine_C
extended.description: Total carbon in fine root biomass. Typical size cutoff (max.diameter_root) is 1-2 mm diameter.

variable.name: deadwood_OM
extended.description: Total mass of aboveground dead wood, including standing dead wood and woody debris.
IPCC.notes: IPCC definition (Table 1.1): Includes all non-living woody biomass not contained in the litter, either standing, lying on the ground, or in the soil. Dead wood includes wood lying on the surface, dead roots, and stumps, larger than or equal to 10 cm in diameter (or the diameter specified by the country).

variable.name: deadwood_C
extended.description: Total carbon in aboveground dead wood, including standing dead wood and woody debris.
IPCC.notes: IPCC definition (Table 1.1): Includes all non-living woody biomass not contained in the litter, either standing, lying on the ground, or in the soil. Dead wood includes wood lying on the surface, dead roots, and stumps, larger than or equal to 10 cm in diameter (or the diameter specified by the country).

variable.name: deadwood_standing_OM
extended.description: Total mass of aboveground standing dead wood (snags).

variable.name: deadwood_standing_C
extended.description: Total carbon in aboveground standing dead wood (snags).

variable.name: deadwood_down_OM
extended.description: Total mass of downed dead wood (coarse and sometimes fine woody debris).

variable.name: deadwood_down_C
extended.description: Total carbon in downed dead wood (coarse and sometimes fine woody debris).

variable.name: litter_OM
extended.description: Mass of litter, or relatively undecomposed plant material (OL soil horizon).
review.notes: incomplete in that it doesn't include full O horizon, or belowground

variable.name: litter_C
extended.description: C in litter, or relatively undecomposed plant material (OL soil horizon).
review.notes: incomplete in that it doesn't include full O horizon, or belowground

variable.name: organic.layer_OM
extended.description: Mass of litter/ organic layer/ forest floor, where components included have not been clearly defined
review.notes: ambiguous as to whether this is just litter or entire O.horizon; therefore, not sent to IPCC

variable.name: organic.layer_C
extended.description: C content of litter/ organic layer/ forest floor, where components included have not been clearly defined
review.notes: ambiguous as to whether this is just litter or entire O.horizon; therefore, not sent to IPCC

variable.name: O.horizon_OM
extended.description: Mass of entire organic horizon, including litter (OL), fumic (OF), and humic (OH) layers.
IPCC.notes: IPCC threshhold between CWD and litter is 10cm diameter.

variable.name: O.horizon_C
extended.description: C content of entire organic horizon, including litter (OL), fumic (OF), and humic (OH) layers.
IPCC.notes: IPCC threshhold between CWD and litter is 10cm diameter.

variable.name: soil_OM
extended.description: Soil organic matter to specified depth in mineral soil.
IPCC.C_pool: Soil organic matter - mineral soils [SOM mineral] (OMM)
IPCC.notes: IPCC default is 30cm depth

variable.name: soil_C
extended.description: Soil organic carbon to specified depth in mineral soil.
IPCC.C_pool: Soil organic matter - mineral soils [SOM mineral] (OMM)
IPCC.notes: IPCC default is 30cm depth

variable.name: stand.density
IPCC.notes: ancillary info for biomass density variable

variable.name: LAI
IPCC.notes: ancillary info for biomass density variable

variable.name: foliage_pN
description: Accumulation of foliage N of stand

variable.name: root_pN
description: Percent N in belowground live tissue

variable.name: root_pC
description: Percent C in belowground live tissue

variable.name: N.mineralization
IPCC.notes: relevant when associated with a land use/management change

variable.name: max.diameter
description: Maximum diameter of tree part being measured (stem, woody debris)
IPCC.notes: ancillary info

variable.name: min.diameter
description: Minimum diameter of tree part being measured (stem, woody debris)
IPCC.notes: ancillary info

variable.name: max.diameter_branch
IPCC.notes: ancillary info

variable.name: min.diameter_branch
IPCC.notes: ancillary info

variable.name: max.diameter_twig
IPCC.notes: ancillary info

variable.name: max.diameter_root
IPCC.notes: ancillary info

variable.name: min.diameter_root
IPCC.notes: ancillary info

variable.name: min.diameter_liana
IPCC.notes: ancillary info

variable.name: min.height
IPCC.notes: ancillary info

variable.name: min.length
IPCC.notes: ancillary info

variable.name: stem.level
description: Indicates whether the variable is computed at the individual tree (0; e.g., only counts mortality if all stems of a multi-stemmed individual die) or stem (1; e.g., counts stem mortality when the individual tree remains alive) level.
IPCC.notes: ancillary info

variable.name: include.recruitment
description: Indicates whether recruitment is counted as part of ANPP_woody_stem (0-no; 1-yes)
IPCC.notes: ancillary info
